item.title: Fixed. [close]
item.dc:creator: @All_Time_Low All Time Low
item.description:
@All_Time_Low wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:472887”][quote author=All Time Low link=topic=590746.msg4179823#msg4179823 date=1355375601]
I compiled, no errors.
I found all the IP’s since their were 3 worlds to select from, changed them all to 127.0.0.1 and then their was 3 different ports also and changed them all to 43594 also.

Bump, someone please help me. :
[/quote]

  1. It’s not a bump considering you are still on page 1…
  2. I’m trying to help so chill yo’ beans.
    Make sure the server is also set to 43594. The server doesn’t need an IP because it’s set to a global IP, meaning it doesn’t matter what IP you use, the server is casted on it.
    Anyways, the last time I had this issue, it was because there was a problem with my client.java/server.java and nothing came up wrong, but it wouldn’t let anything connect.[/quote]
  1. My bad.
  2. You took forever. & i doubled check and i remember i forgot to search "Server = " for different unsearchable ip’s.
    Forgot that there is ip’s there that need to be changed also, now it works.
    Thanks for reminding me!

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed. [close]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“All Time Low, post:3, topic:472887”]I compiled, no errors.
I found all the IP’s since their were 3 worlds to select from, changed them all to 127.0.0.1 and then their was 3 different ports also and changed them all to 43594 also.

Bump, someone please help me. :[/quote]

  1. It’s not a bump considering you are still on page 1…
  2. I’m trying to help so chill yo’ beans.
    Make sure the server is also set to 43594. The server doesn’t need an IP because it’s set to a global IP, meaning it doesn’t matter what IP you use, the server is casted on it.
    Anyways, the last time I had this issue, it was because there was a problem with my client.java/server.java and nothing came up wrong, but it wouldn’t let anything connect.

Read full topic

item.title: Fixed. [close]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“All Time Low, post:1, topic:472887”]So i downloaded PkXile Reborn from r-server and i can’t seem to get the client and source to connect using port 43594 and ip 127.0.0.1.
I’m not trying to host it i just wanna code it from my computer…

Other people on r-server are having the same problem…

It just say’s error connecting and i have ran Rsps server’s before i have experience i know what i’m doing, just not this time.

Anyone please wanna help me?

Skype: I-Pk-Banks

Thanks for reading![/quote]
Try to compile the server and check for errors.
Make sure the client is set to 127.0.0.1 some have more then 1 IP

Read full topic
